# Meta ([cranlogs](https://github.com/metacran/cranlogs)) wikipediatrend ```{r, fig.width=10, echo=FALSE, fig.retina=TRUE, message=FALSE} library(cranlogs) library(jsonlite) library(stringr) wptrendversions <- grep( "version \\d{1,3}.\\d{1,3}.\\d{1,3}.*//", readLines("NEWS"), value = TRUE ) wptrendversions <- data.frame( version = str_extract(wptrendversions, "\\d{1,3}.\\d{1,3}.\\d{1,3}"), date = str_extract(wptrendversions, "\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}") ) rversions <- fromJSON("http://rversions.r-pkg.org/r-versions") downloads <- cran_downloads( package = "wikipediatrend", from = "2014-09-01", to = Sys.Date() )[,1:2] downloads_cum <- data.frame( date = downloads$date, sum = round(cumsum(downloads$count)/1000,1) ) downloads_cum <- downloads_cum[ !duplicated(downloads_cum$sum) & downloads_cum$sum %% 1 == 0 , ] downloads_cum$date[1] <- "2014-11-07" plot(downloads, type="l", ylim = c(-40,80)) text(as.Date(rversions$date),-17,labels = rversions$version, col = "red", srt=0, cex=0.7) #segments(x0=as.Date(rversions$date),x1=as.Date(rversions$date),y0=0,y1=10,col="red", lwd=2) text(as.Date(wptrendversions$date),c(-23,-27),labels = wptrendversions$version, col = "steelblue", srt=0, cex=0.7) #segments(x0=as.Date(wptrendversions$date),x1=as.Date(wptrendversions$date),y0=0,y1=10,col="steelblue",lwd = 2) text(downloads_cum$date, -34, downloads_cum$sum, cex=0.7, col = "darkgreen") text(as.Date("2014-08-15"),-25,"wp versions", col="steelblue", cex=0.7,pos=4) text(as.Date("2014-08-15"),-17,"R versions", col="red", cex=0.7,pos=4) text(as.Date("2014-08-15"),-34,"K downloads", col="darkgreen", cex=0.7,pos=4) abline(h=c(0),col="black") #abline(h=c(-40,-10),col="grey") lines( loess.smooth(downloads$date, downloads$count, span = 1/5, degree = 2, family = c("gaussian"), evaluation = 50), col="darkgreen", lwd=2) ``` # Purpose The wikipediatrend package is designed to make Wikipedia page access statistics data availible in R in a most convenient way. *Consequently the package provides* - daily page views as data frames - page views for user set time spans - page views for multiple articles in one function call - page views for articles in different language domains - a function to check article titles in other country domains - background caching of results to minimize function execution time as well as server burdens # Installation A stable version of the package can be found on CRAN and installed via ... ```{r, eval=FALSE} install.packages("wikipediatrend") ``` ... while the current developement version can be retrieved by using `install_github()` from the devtools package ... ```{r, eval=FALSE} devtools::install_github("petermeissner/wikipediatrend") ``` After loading the package several functions are available. ```{r, error=TRUE, message=FALSE} library(wikipediatrend) ``` # Usage ## getting data The workhorse of the package is the `wp_trend()` function: ```{r, cache=TRUE, error=TRUE, message=c(1:3, 30:33)} wp <- wp_trend(page = c("Fever","Fieber"), from = "2013-08-01", to = "2015-12-31", lang = c("en","de")) # (... messages shortened) ``` ## glancing data The function's return is a data frame with six variables *date*, *count*, *project*, *title*, *rank*, *month* paralleling the data provided by the stats.grok.se server: ```{r, cache=TRUE, error=TRUE} head(wp) ``` ## plotting data ```{r, fig.width=10, echo=FALSE, fig.retina=TRUE, message=FALSE} library(ggplot2) ggplot(wp, aes(date, count, group=page, color = page)) + geom_point() + geom_smooth(method="lm", formula = y ~ poly(x, 20), size=1.5) + theme_bw() ``` ## other languages Furthermore, wikipediatrend provides a helper function `wp_linked_pages()` which allows to query wikipedia if a particualr article exists in other languages as well: ```{r} wp_linked_pages("Hitsche", lang="de") ``` # Vignette *For a more detailed usage have a look at the vignette accompanying the package. `vignette("using-wikipediatrend", package="wikipediatrend")`* ... or GoTo [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/package=wikipediatrend) or build it from scratch from [Github](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/petermeissner/wikipediatrend/master/vignettes/using-wikipediatrend.Rmd). # Some examples for using page view statistics in general - politan.ch (2015-10-04): *Welche Standeratskandidaturen interessieren?.* politan.ch. http://www.politan.ch/welche-standeratskandidaturen-interessieren/ - politan.ch (2015-05-25): *Wenn Klicks Stimmen waren.* politan.ch. http://www.politan.ch/wenn-klicks-stimmen-waren/ - Munzert, Simon (2015): *Using Wikipedia Page View Statistics to Measure Issue Salience.* WEBDATANET CONFERENCE 2015. http://conference.webdatanet.eu/uploads/submission/full_paper/35/munzert-wikipedia-webdatanet.pdf -
